mixed-citation.article-title: Taxonomic study of the genus Microplitis Förster, 1862 (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from Iran

tp:treatment-sec.p: Body length 3.5–4.0 mm; antenna as long as body, F15 length 2.0 × its width ( Fig. 8A ); anteromesoscutum and mesoscutellar disc weakly rugulose or coriaceous ( Fig. 8C ); pterostigma length 2.1 × its width; vein R1 longer than pterostigma half; 1 st discal cell length 1.3–1.4 × its width; vein 1CUb 2.0 × as long as vein 1CUa ( Fig. 8D ); T1 rugose, distinctly broadening posteriorly and T1 length slightly longer than its maximum width; T2 rugulose ( Fig. 8D ). Colour: body yellow or reddish yellow except for black head, brown mesoscutellar disc and metanotum; basal one third of pterostigma yellow.
